articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ALISTAIR JOHNSTON feared he might be forced to miss Celtic’s glory run-in to the season after being crocked in the crucial 2-1 derby triumph at Parkhead at the weekend. articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC do NOT need to sell in-demand midfield mastermind Matt O’Riley in the summer. The London-born Danish international playmaker, who cost a bargain £1.5million from English third-tier club MK Dons in January 2022, has been linked with a big-money exit from the champions. La Liga giants Atletico Madrid failed in a bid to sign O’Riley [...]

articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS is planning a summer signing spree to strengthen Celtic. The champions are on the cusp of their third successive title as they look for at least one point against Kilmarnock at Rugby Park tonight to make absolutely certain. The Hoops can seal a league and Cup double in the second coming of the Irishman [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: TOMMY BURNS’ last goodbye as Celtic manager came in the aftermath of a sensational 1-0 Scottish Cup semi-final replay defeat against Falkirk on April 23 1997. articles.description: TOMMY BURNS passed away on this date 16 years ago at the all-too-young age of 51. articles.description: EXACTLY forty-two years ago today, Celtic were on the brink of the club’s 33rd championship victory.
